meanings.definition: A person who shirks work or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: Tom is known as a goldbrick at the office because he avoids doing his tasks.
meanings.sent2: The supervisor warned everyone to watch out for any goldbrick trying to avoid their duties.
meanings.sent3: When the team needed help, Jerry pretended to be a goldbrick and disappeared.
meanings.sent4: Her lazy attitude turned her into a goldbrick, just sitting around while others worked.
meanings.sent5: The goldbrick in the group always finds a way to avoid contributing to the project.

meanings.sent1: The scammer tried to goldbrick unsuspecting victims with promises of easy money.
meanings.sent2: Be cautious of those who may try to goldbrick you into making hasty decisions.
meanings.sent3: The con artist's plan to goldbrick the elderly couple was foiled by the vigilant neighbor.
meanings.sent4: She realized too late that the smooth-talking salesman had managed to goldbrick her into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest contractor attempted to goldbrick the homeowner by overcharging for repairs.

meanings.definition: A worthless object that appears valuable.
meanings.sent1: The shiny rock turned out to be a mere goldbrick, fooling many with its appearance.
meanings.sent2: The antique vase was actually a goldbrick, with no historical significance.
meanings.sent3: The treasure hunter was disappointed to find the chest filled with goldbrick replicas.
meanings.sent4: The jewelry store unknowingly sold a goldbrick necklace, thinking it was genuine.
meanings.sent5: The museum curator was embarrassed to discover the artifact was just a goldbrick imitation.
